titleStmt.title: The Kentish miracle; or, A strange and miraculous work of Gods providence, shewed to a poor distressed widdow, and her seven small fatherless children. Who lived by a burnt six-penny loaf of bread, and a little water, for above seven weeks, in the wild of Kent, to the praise and glory of almighty God. To the tune of, A rich merchant-man. Entred according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-Spur-street without Newgate.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
